reviews.sentence: fabulous stay servicefodgreat xtras. restaurant was amazing. breakfast rocked. staff fantastic. free nespreso coke and water juice is a really nice touch. Brilliant stay only 2 downsides inside room could hear alot of passing noise in the corridor. Outside room window room alot of outside noise and the room is slightly smaller so walking space becomes a juggle. However none of this would stop us coming again or recomending to others. Top notch location and well deserved 8 rating out of ten. The rooms are small but very functional and dare i say it cool. We stayed in 2 different pantone rooms and even with the 2nd room being a tight fit we just loved it. Good hawker food right out front of the hotel and a little to the left 5 average meal and a bar open cafe directly opposite lol convenience is awesome. Beds are crazy comfortable and free mini bar drinks very welcome.

Best stay ever. Service concept breakfast. Best hotel service we have received. There were also nice personal touches such as the complimentary SG50 toothpaste provided by the hotel during our stay. We stayed in the Tree Monster room and are really impressed with the beautiful decorations. Breakfast at Cocotte was also amazing great food great service great ambience. There was also a cosy jacuzi at level 2 where you can soak under the stars.
Good staycation. Cleanliness nice breakfast comfort. The room was clean and comfortable. There were also free drinks available in the fridge. I enjoyed my stay here.

fun place with exceptional service. we stayed here for three nights and loved it. the hotel is central singapore little india. staff are amazing so attentive and kind. the rooms are eccentric but fun though my partner found the space small. so get the yellow room or one of the larger ones if this is a concern. the rooms have smart phones for you to use makes exploring the city easy plus large tvs and very comfortable matreses. breakfast is included and is delicious. the staff make this place and made our time there comfortable. thank you.
Really Decent. the space theme room was really cool. thumbs up. breakfast was good toenjoyed my staycation there.

Boutique hotel in Little India. We booked a standard room which had quite an unusual design but was a bit small. The bed is raised at the end of the room under the window. Shower and toilet take up quite a bit of space and there is no room for seating. There are some shelves a Nespreso machine and a wardrobe with a safe and a small bar fridge stocked up with free nonalcoholic drinks. Internet was free. There are comfortable common areas and an in house French restaurant. There was quite a choice for breakfast orders. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay at this handy location close to MRT buses close to eateries and shops in Serangon Road. We liked the atmosphere of the place the location the food and the staff. The place was very clean and the towels provided were large and fluffy. The nearest MRT is Rochor Road but Bugis Street Little India are also close. Plenty of choice for cheap eateries and Thai massages. We found the mattress too soft and missed other seating desk.

Chic boutique in Little India Singapore. My taxi pulled up to this hotel which was nestled in the hustle and bustle of Little India a vibrant area that is in contrast to the skyrise clinilcal nature of the rest of Singapore. The hotel reminded me of Shoreditch in London chic and decorated in interesting and unique design. I did not eat at the restaurant but the room which was illuminated in various colours of your choosing was very comfortable and the outdoor jacuzi looked lovely. The only downside is that there was no double glazing on the windows so the noise of the street disrupted my sleep.

Good hotel. Very quirky hotel with lots of little extras in the room good location on the edge of Little India with metro stations close by. Would not hesitate to book again but would pay more for a better room I did not realize that the room had nowhere to put your things so we lived out of our suitcase for 3 days not handy. Breakfast very good and everyone we met where very helpful.

Amazing hotel centrally located. Wanderlust Hotel is ideally located near to Rochor MRT station but is also very near Bugis and Little India stations. Check in was smooth and efficient and you are provided with a much needed cold water of water. The rooms are of the very highest standard we stayed in the Pantone Cyan room which was cool and design focussed. The overall design and decoration of the hotel is fresh modern and well thought out. Breakfast was an absolute treat with main courses made fresh for you. You select your choice by completing the forms available on the table which are then collected by the fabulous and friendly lady who runs the serving. While waiting there is a great choice of things at the semi buffet. Breakfast here truly sets you up for a day around Singapore. One of the very best things about the Wanderlust Hotel is the Handy mobile phone which you can borrow from the room. You get free calls and Internet for the duration of your stay and is great for taking out and about. It saves worrying about roaming fees and trying to find Wifi hotspots although this is rarely a problemOveral I would 100 recommend Wanderlust Hotel. It is a fabulous base from which to explore one of the worlds truly dynamic cities.

Nice design hotel with good front of house staff let down by price and bar restaurant. it is only been one month since this Design Hotel enabled reservations through Starwod thereby awarding points and eligible nights for SPG members if not the rest of the member benefits. In the event it has become the slightly cheapest SPG hotel in Singapore I paid S190 a night vs the Sheratons S20 at least until July when the refurbished Four Points opens its doors so it got my three night reservation thereby also getting me a free additional night at any SPG Category 5 hotel could be worth US 200 or moreThe hotel is a small boutique hotel down a side street walking distance from the new Rocher MRT. Location is bit out of the way but it enabled me to explore some of Singapore I have never been to before and eat some good cheap Indian food for lunch. Check in at 1 pm two hours early was quick at the small reception by very pleasant receptionists and I saw my reservation had been made through an agency called Valhalla rather an anything that identified Starwod. No mention of SPG or indeed any Platinum benefits which was to be expected. SPGcom had n’t given me any choice but I ’d booked a Mono room apparently the corridor is black and the room is white. Otherwise the room appeared a bit featureless and bare for a design hotel. Second floor rooms are designed like capsules but pictures of the top floor rooms look the best. The Mono room is kind of like an Aloft in function. Small sink in the bedroom shower and toilet in an attached wet room. I had been allocated the wheelchair room opposite the lift I am pitch perfect on the lifts ping now. The wet room design meant the shower went all over the toilet seat. A lot of amenities in the room. Toothbrushes vanity kit shower gel and shampoo safe Nespreso machine with four capsules four types of tea including camomile a selection of ten free soft drinks in a fridge whose door opened the wrong way which would make it challenging for a wheelchair user to get at including yes Coke Zero so happy about that. Also an Android phone to create WiFi hot spots out and about that was labelled only for customers who book direct I have my own cheap Android phone for this purpose a five day 10Gb tourist sim in Singapore only costs S15. Super comfy double bed. A card apologised for the noise outside the room that was beyond their control but was helpfully accompanied by two sets of ear plugs. In the event the offending street restaurant plastic chairs and tables line the pavement was serving all night but it was n’t raucous and did not keep me awake. There are no full service hotel amenities here like a gym club room swimming pool or business centre but there is a small sun deck with jacuzi that I sat in one afternoon and it was sunny and peaceful during the day. Housekeeping was very friendly but the wifi felt slow and a speed test revealed about 1Mbps connection which is not much for Singapore. I had good feelings after I checked in but this dissipated by the first night. The room heavily promotes its French restaurant Cocotte in the lobby but I am afraid my experiences there were very disappointing. First I fancied a beer late afternoon in the lobby bar but was told it was closed between lunch and dinner times. I understand the kitchen being closed but the hotel bar in a lobby that is clearly designed to hang out in. I do not understand that. Then that evening I decided to try the five course menu with accompanying wines. It was 830pm and there was a large company meal in full swing so I asked if I could take one of the high tables in the empty bar nicer for a single diner anyway. Apparently not because it was booked by the private function even though they were all in the restaurant and the bar area was deserted. So I was sat near the kitchen in the restaurant. Although it was hardly late and the private function was having a great time I felt that I was being rushed through the meal with the second course arriving before I had finished the first. Also the waiter explained very abruptly that the accompanying wine portions were tasting sizes without me having reacted to the size of the pour at all. The French inspired food was good especially the duck. but I did not enjoy the steak which was quite flavourless yet fatty. Good fries though. My feeling of being rushed was confirmed when the bill arrived while I was still eating at 1010pm even though the private function was still clearly on going. What really annoyed me though was that I could not charge the meal to my room bill. The waiter flatly refused. So why I wondered had they blocked my credit card when I checked in for more than the room rate. there is little else to spend money on here. By now I was irritated by the whole experience and sincerely wished I had eaten elsewhere. I had tried to win the waiter over by smiling and being super polite throughout but as I stood up to leave I was totally ignored while he laid the table next to me for breakfast without a thanks or a see you again. And consequently they did not get my S25 for breakfast each morningIncidentaly turn right out of the hotel walk 25 m and you will find an excellent restaurant called Roots that has a good and good value dinner set for S50 nett. Friendly service and very good food. I enjoyed my evening meal there so much I returned for brunch the next dayBoking through SPGcom meant I got points qualifying nights and the special offer additional free night at a Starwod Category 5 hotel of my choice. Otherwise I would have felt a bit upset about the price paid vs the value compared to the Sheraton. And the fact you can not charge food and drink to your room means you do not get points for this spend either which further devalues the place the meal should have got me 500 Starpoints. I know that some people will say that this is a totally different type of hotel and I should not compare but for 10 more I had have got breakfast a club lounge evening drinks and food a pool gym and points for all my spend at the Sheraton. Even without the Sheraton comparison at S190 in this backpacker area for a limited service hotel it felt over priced. Again not a direct comparison but the Hotel 81 Dickson across the road which has exactly the same facilities ie no pool gym bar in the afternoon etc. is less than half the price of the Wanderlust. I also got the feeling that the hotel views SPGcom as simply another Agoda or Bokingcom. that is not a complaint as I had no elevated expectations of Platinum recognition but it would not make me book another Design Hotel in the future if there was an adequate Starwod hotel nearby. In the end if it had not been for the complete disconnect between the hotel and the lobby bar restaurant I would have been happy if not delighted with my stay here mainly because of the friendly reception staff rather than it being good value or the Mono room being a fun and stylishly designed place to sleep. But the service and policies in the bar restaurant did succeed in annoying me which is a real feat because I am quite benign. So what would have been a happy Good stay for the price if it cost S150 160 it could score Very Good. loses a point to become Poor.

Awesome stay. Wanderlust was overall good comfort was there. bed was comfy except the room is not really that soundproof but for a night stay it was simple awesome. For those looking for Halal cafe there is one nearby the malayan council. The price abit too pricey.

Average Hotel in the Hood. I have spent 3 nights at Wanderlust and overall it is an average good hotel. I stayed in the orange pantone room which is bright orange and tiny. I would not recommend it for 2 people. For a solo traveller it is ok. The hotel is located in Little India very near Rochor MRT station 5 minute walk. The hotel is in the hood around funky horrible mini marts and dodgy looking restaurants. The hotel itself is fine. The lobby restaurant bar is quaint and that is about it. Breakfast is also good but not really what you would expect from a SPG hotel. You choose from 8 options of food avocado on toast eggs and bacon on a brioche complete breakfast with sausage and scrambled eggs and 3 kinds of beverage coffee 1 kind of juice and teaPros Comfy bed with great linen and good towels Nespreso Machine Complimentary Mini bar with water coke juice Some sort of in room cell phone with aps and stuf Good housekeping Good quality toiletries. Cons Pantone rooms are color coded. You might end up in an ALL bright yellow or red rom Room is so dark Room is so tiny. If travelling with another person pick another kind of room not the pantone unles you want to share every noise and smel It is a bit noisy outside thanks to an alley cafe bar photo of the view and bar cafe The room is definitely not sound proof. Seems like the walls are made of some sort of plaster. If I come back to amazing Singapore again I will not be staying here.

Flooded room and hallway. Accidents can happen everywhere but in this hotel I was very disappointed by how the staff and management responded to an emergency. At 4 am the water pipes in the hallway in front of my room broke and the hallway and my room were flooded. It was a big shock and a horrible experience but about 30 min later a member of the staff stopped the flooding. He also told me it is the 3rd time this happened in a few months. I asked at front desk to be moved to another room but was told the hotel was fully booked. I returned to my room where I could not sleep because the water was still dripping and there was no hot water in the shower as well. The next day it was impossible to rest since plumbers were working in front of my room making loud noises the whole area in front of my room was wet dirty and smelly. When I reported this to front desk they offered to give me a 20 discount on the first night because I only missed 4 hours of sleep they said. I found this offensive to be honest and asked for a free night and complimentary breakfast as a gesture to compensate for the lack of sleep and comfort. After being awake for 4 hours I would have really appreciated to have a complimentary breakfast to feel at home in the hotel. The front desk agent did not let me talk to the manager and refused to compensate with breakfast because the onsite restaurant is not operated by the hotel she said. The lack of any understanding by the management and staff for the trouble and safety of their guests is appalling and I strongly discourage anyone from staying at the Wanderlust hotel.

Quiet little number. First it needs signage it is hard to find and does not look like the photo. it is entrance is directly opposite the Dickson Food Markets. We rang the hotel to confirm location. they were very helpful. The onboarding was quick and professional with the first impression of the hotel from the foyer was that it was new and done in cool industrial theme concrete floors exposed interiors etc. We had a mono room done in a black and white style with quirky bathroom and toilet layout. This continued the unusual and quirky hotel fit out and decor. Room was clean and tidy and the bed was really comfortable. We ate in the food court across the street on the corner which was easy to sort out do not order salad prawns unles you like fried prawns mayo and fruit a little weirdWe left next morning before 6 am and they sorted the taxi and even made breakfast to go. All up interesting and unusual hotel helpful professional staff. Would stay there again. Not so sure about the name sounds like short term love hotel.

Family vacation. Stayed here for roughly a week. The room was a little cosy but everything was comfortable and clean. Shower had great pressure and the mattress was soft but firm. I hit a snag on the first day when I asked for a latte downstairs because they had a beautiful coffee machine behind the bar. Apparently however that machine is only a decoration and broke last year and they had tried to fix it but ended up giving up on it. They serve percolated coffee with horrible long life milk so you are better off having the chai tea with your breakfast it is a little on the sweet side but still enjoyable. Even though the coffee machine was busted our room had one of those Nespreso pod machines that made up for it. Our first day breakfast was amazing I had the eggs and avocado and was very pleased with the meal. The second day however the chefs were different so for some reason the same meal came out different and I had to ask for what was missing from the previous day. The great thing about the hotel is it is located in little India and there is a wonderful Indian food restaurant about 100 m to the right as you come out of the hotel. it is on the left hand side corner of the first intersection. If you go left past that Indian place and right at the next intersection there is a 71Al in all a comfortable stay we liked the design with all the retro barber chairs and neon lights. The drink were decently priced and they had an acceptable range. I had probably try another different place but I would not recommend this place for a family more for a couples holiday.
Had dinner at the hotel restaurant. Food was good but portions a little small.

Quaint little hoyel. Very good management. Very flexible. Allowed early checkin based on my request. Very clean hotel and excellent facilities and location. Could have tie ups for tour packages and also improve breakfast menu for vegetarians.

Wanderlust Hotel is an eclectic boutique hotel in the vicinity of one of the most famous and colourful neighborhoods in Singapore Little India. The hotel is surrounded by industrial shops local food vendors markets and hawker centres. it is also just moments from Singapore ’s incredible MRT system which makes it the perfect base for further city exploring. The most exciting part about this hotel no two rooms are the same. During inception the hotel partnered with four award winning local design agencies Asylum Phunk Studio DP Architects and fFurious. Each agency was granted total creative freedom to transform an entire floor in the hotel. Fun fact the hotel was originally an old school built in the 1920s. On the first level of the hotel themed Industrial Glam by Asylum you will find outdated industrial pieces scattered throughout the entrance lounge wine bar and restaurant. Spotted old barber chairs dentist ceiling lights old fashioned leather sofas and even a traditional and complementary Singaporean snack cart. The second floor themed ‘ Eccentricity ’ by Phunk Studio hosts a variety of rooms featuring different Pantone colours neon signs and musical inspiration. The bright and entirely yellow suite known as ‘ Yellow Submarine ’ inspired by The Beatles is a guest favourite and ours too. Check out that vintage cast iron tubthere is even a rainbow corridor to explore leading to a rainbow jacuzi. The third floor themed ‘ Is It Just Black and White ’. by DP Architects features nine rooms with sharp black and white contrast. Half of the rooms are inspired by the Japanese art of Origami and the other by Pop Art. On the top floor themed ‘ Creature Comforts ’ by fFurious there are nine spacious duplex suites. The theme was influenced by the idea that travel experiences become much more memorable when we have met or have made a new friend. fFurious designed each room with its own friendly creature to welcome guests and to bring them comfort in a new place. These unique creatures are born from different themes a typewriter tree space ASCII table and bling. The quirky hotel has also integrated a new wine dine concept WINEDERLUST by Unlisted Collection. The wine and bistro bar has over 300 labels of wine available and creative dishes for pairing. The menu continues to evolve by the “ Young Chef Movement ” programme which collaborates with young chefs inspiring restaurants from around the world.
Small rooms but everything you need and for the price would definitely return. Just avoid the overpriced restaurant downstairs.

Clean Hotel Good Location Friendly Staff. The staff at the hotel were the best. Allowed me to work from the cafe area during non opening hours as i needed to complete stuff for work. The rooms are really interesting but small if you wanted to spend a day chilling in it. Toilet and shower room need a bit getting used to as they were right in the middle of the room but its conveniently located close to all shopping areas. Will definitely stay here again. Thank you to all the staff who made my stay a pleasant one.
